identificationModule.briefTitle: Serotonin Selective Reuptake Inhibitor (SSRI) Effects on Cerebral Connectivity in Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Resting State MRI Connectivity in Acute Ischemic Stroke: Serotonin Selective Reuptake Inhibitor (SSRI) in Enhancing Motor Recovery: a Placebo Controlled Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Fluoxetine action on cerebral connectivity changes in acute ischemic stroke patients
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: In this placebo-controlled study, using functional resting state MRI, the investigators aim to investigate cerebral connectivity changes induced by fluoxetine given once a day for 90 days, in stroke patients with a moderate to severe motor deficit.

armGroups.label: Fluoxetine
armGroups.description: One group will take a 20 mg of fluoxetine capsule per day from D0 to D90 and have fMRI

armGroups.label: Placebo
armGroups.description: The other group will take a cellulose placebo per day from D0 to D90 and have fMRI

interventions.name: Fluoxetine
interventions.description: 20 mg of fluoxetine capsule per day from D0 to D90

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: cellulose placebo per day from D0 to D90

primaryOutcomes.measure: Intracerebral connectivity in the motor network between fluoxetine and placebo group.
primaryOutcomes.description: Intracerebral connectivity difference in the motor network, assessed by functional resting state MRI, between fluoxetine and placebo group after the treatment.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Intracerebral connectivity in the motor network between good responders patients
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Intracerebral connectivity difference in the motor network, assessed by functional resting state MRI, in fluoxetine and placebo good responders patients, defined by :

* 8 points gain on the National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS), assessed between D0 and D30 and between D0 and D90
* or 2 points gain on the modified Rankin score (mRS) assessed between D0 and D30 and between D0 and D90.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Intracerebral connectivity in the motor network between non-responders patients
secondaryOutcomes.description: Intracerebral connectivity difference in the motor network, assessed by functional resting state MRI, in non-responders patients of fluoxetine and placebo group.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* First-ever ischemic stroke
* Cortical or subcortical stroke
* National Institute of Health Stroke Scale NIHSS\>12 or motor NIHSS\>6 at inclusion
* MRI-proved ischemic stroke

Exclusion Criteria:

* pregnant or breast-feeding women
* alcoholism
* ongoing Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitor treatment or interruption \< 1 month
* allergic reaction after SSRI administration
* MRI contraindication
* NIHSS\>22
* Severe aphasia
* Coma
